intro: Dicerma hispidum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed dicerma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Dicerma hispidum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
